wikipedia_page.main: Major General Horatio Pettus Mackintosh Berney-Ficklin,  (13 June 1892 – 17 February 1961) was a British Army officer who served in both the First and Second World Wars. During the latter, he commanded for just over three years – from July 1940 until August 1943 – the 5th Infantry Division (nicknamed "The Globe Trotters"), the most widely travelled division of the British Army during the Second World War.

response: *1946–1947: Maj-Gen. Horatio Pettus Mackintosh Berney-Ficklin, CB, MC
